titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Walter McChesney, J. O. Hunter, Charles Hooper, & Benjamin T. Gray, Indictment
CWG6500

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell Circuit. Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Indictment for Robery
Walter McChesney. J O Hunter. Charles Hooper. & Benjamin T Gray.

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: accuse Walter McChesney. J O Hunter Charles Hooper and Benjamin T Gray of the crime of Robery. Committed as follows viz The said Walter McChesney. J O Hunter Charles Hooper and Benjamin T Gray on the 30th day of October 1862 in the County aforesaid feloniously took dry goods, wares, and merchandize the property of William H Baley from his possession and his presence anyd against his will by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Information given by
Wm H Baley
J R Farlip
L S Thomson Foreman Grand Jury
D W McGoodwin attorny
for the Commonwealth protem

A Copy
atteste E P Watkins Clk c c c
By F W Dabney D C
Bench Warrant to Issue and bail fixed for each of defts att $300.

A copy a
att F W Dabney D C

Commonwealth of Ky
v } Indictment for Robery
Walter McChesney. J O Hunter Charles Hooper Ben T Gray
Filed & noted in open Court Decr 3d 1862.
att J O Barnes D C
Issd
A Copy
